'''Roberto Maximiliano Pereyra''' ({{IPA-es|roˈβeɾto peˈɾeiɾa}}; born 7 January 1991) is an Argentine [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and the Argentina national team. Pereyra is right-footed and plays as a [[midfielder]] but can also play as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]]. Due to his versatility, he is capable of playing a variety of positions such as a left or right [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]], a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]], an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] or even as a [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|second striker]].<ref name="Roberto Pereyra, nuovi Zanetti crescono">{{cite web|url=http://www.calciosudamericano.it/roberto-pereyra-nuovi-zanetti-crescono/|title=Roberto Pereyra, nuovi Zanetti crescono...|trans-title=Roberto Pereyra, new Zanettis are developing...|publisher=Calcio Sudamericano|author1=Andrea Bracco|language=Italian|date=5 July 2011|accessdate=11 June 2015}}</ref>
After beginning his career in Argentina with [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]], he joined Italian club [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] in 2011, where his performances earned him a loan to defending league champions [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in 2014; he was signed permanently by the team in 2015 and won two consecutive [[Serie A]] titles during his time with the club. During his time in Italy, he developed into a well-rounded, adaptable, and tactically versatile player due to his dynamism, energy, and technique, as well as his offensive and defensive work-rate and attributes.<ref name="Pereyra, dinamismo e duttilità">{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/it/news/pereyra%20dinamismo%20e%20duttilita|title=Pereyra, dinamismo e duttilità|trans-title=Pereyra, dynamism and versatility|publisher=Juventus|language=Italian|date=25 July 2015|accessdate=11 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150613020935/http://www.juventus.com/juve/it/news/pereyra%20dinamismo%20e%20duttilita|archivedate=13 June 2015|df=}}</ref> In 2016, he joined Watford.
At international level, Pereyra represented the Argentina national football team at the [[2015 Copa América]], winning a runners-up medal in the tournament.
==Club career==
===River Plate=== Born in [[San Miguel de Tucumán]], [[Argentina]], Pereyra began his career within the youth academy of [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]]; due to his origins, he was given the nickname "El Tucumano".<ref name="Roberto Pereyra, nuovi Zanetti crescono"/> His professional career began in 2009 when he made his River Plate debut in the Argentine Primera Division against Huracan at the age of 18.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.argentinesoccer.com/player_apps.cfm?id=rpry&Championship=cl09&Team=riv |title=Closing '09 statistics |publisher=Argentine Soccer |accessdate=29 July 2011 }}</ref> After featuring on 43 occasions for River, Pereyra transferred across the [[Atlantic Ocean]], swapping continents, as he joined [[Udinese Calcio]] ahead of the [[2011–12 Serie A]] season.
===Udinese Calcio=== Officially signing for [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] 30 August 2011, Pereyra signed a five-year contract with the Friuli outfit,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.udinese.it/ENG/script/view.php?id=815 |title=Pereyra Declares...Welcome Roberto! |publisher=[[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] |accessdate=31 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110929153023/http://www.udinese.it/ENG/script/view.php?id=815 |archivedate=29 September 2011 |df= }}</ref> and went on to make 15 appearances in all competitions during his debut season in [[Italy]]. His performances for Udinese during a three–year spell saw him contribute eight goals and seven assists in 84 league appearances, while he also represented the club in 6 [[Coppa Italia]] matches, 2 [[UEFA Champions League]] matches, and 12 [[UEFA Europa League]] games.
===Juventus=== [[File:Serie A 2014-15 - Juventus v Napoli - Roberto Pereyra.jpg|thumb|left|Pereyra with Juventus in 2015]]
On 25 July 2014, Pereyra officially signed for, at the time, three-time defending [[2013–14 Serie A|Serie A champions]] [[Juventus Football Club|Juventus]] on a season-long loan deal from Udinese worth €1.5 million, with the option to sign the player outright at the conclusion of the [[2014–15 Serie A]] campaign for an additional €14 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/roberto-pereyra-joins-juventus |title=Pereyra joins Juventus |date=25 July 2014 |publisher=Juventus F.C. |accessdate=25 July 2014}}</ref> On the same day, Pereyra appeared for his club in their first friendly match of the season against Lucento. On 23 August 2014, he featured for Juventus in the annual Trofeo TIM. Pereyra capitalised on Francesco Magnanelli’s failed clearance to sidefoot home from just outside the six-yard box.
On 6 June 2015, Pereyra appeared as a substitute for Juventus in the [[2015 UEFA Champions League Final]] as ''La Vecchia Signora'' was defeated 3–1 by [[FC Barcelona]] at Berlin's [[Olympiastadion Berlin|Olympiastadion]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000552/match=2015227/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Barcelona see off Juventus to claim fifth title|date=6 June 2015|publisher=UEFA}}</ref> With 52 appearances, he made the most appearances for Juventus that season across all competitions, along with teammates [[Claudio Marchisio]] and [[Leonardo Bonucci]].
On 23 June 2015, Juventus bought out Pereyra's Udinese loan for €14 million, keeping him at Juventus until 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.italianfootballdaily.com/official-juventus-exercise-the-buyout-option-for-pereyra-the-financial-details/|title=OFFICIAL: Juventus exercise the buyout option for Pereyra – The Financial Details – IFD|website=italianfootballdaily.com}}</ref>
===Watford=== On 19 August 2016, Pereyra moved to [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a five-year deal for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/watford-complete-roberto-pereyra-signing | title=Watford complete Roberto Pereyra signing |publisher=Watford F.C. | date=19 August 2016 | accessdate=19 August 2016}}</ref> According to an official club statement released by Juventus, the transfer is worth €13 million, with a possible €2 million in bonuses, which is to be paid over a four-year period.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/media/native/investor-relations-docs/english/price-sensitive-press-releases/2015-2016/comunicato%2020082016%20pereyra%20eng[1].pdf|title=AGREEMENT WITH WATFORD FC FOR THE DEFINITIVE DISPOSAL OF THE PLAYER ROBERTO PEREYRA|date=20 August 2016|access-date=20 August 2016|publisher=Juventus F.C.}}</ref> He was assigned the number 37 shirt for the 2016–17 season.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/news/14695162.Hornets_announce_squad_numbers_for_Pereyra_and_Kaboul/?ref=mr&lp=1 | title=Watford announce squad numbers for new signings Roberto Pereyra and Younes Kaboul | work=Watford Observer | date=20 August 2016 | accessdate=20 August 2016 | author=Mail, Simon}}</ref> On his Watford debut, Pereyra scored his first goal for the club in a 3–1 home defeat to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the [[2016–17 Premier League|Premier League]], on 27 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/club/watford/395/blog/post/2939315/roberto-pereyra-gives-watford-hope-in-mixed-display-against-arsenal|title=Roberto Pereyra gives Watford hope in mixed display against Arsenal|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Mike Parkin|date=28 August 2016|accessdate=15 September 2016}}</ref> On 5 February 2018 Pereyra came off the bench to score the fourth goal in a 4–1 thrashing of Chelsea.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42855189|title=Watford 4–1 Chelsea|date=5 February 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
==International career== Pereyra was selected to represent the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentine under-20 football team]] at the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. He played all three group games at the tournament, helping Argentina defeat Mexico and North Korea and draw with England. He missed Argentina's 2–1 Round of 16 victory over Egypt through suspension, but returned to the starting line-up in the Quarterfinal clash against Portugal, which Argentina lost on penalty kicks after neither team could score during 120 minutes.
He made his senior debut for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] on Saturday 11 October 2014 in a 2–0 friendly match loss against [[Brazil National Football Team|Brazil]] played in [[Beijing|Beijing, China]] after being called up by [[Gerardo Martino]].
Pereyra was a member of the Argentine national team that took part at the [[2015 Copa América]], winning a runners-up medal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/news/news/2015/argentina-through-to-copa-america-final.php|title=Argentina through to Copa America final|publisher=Juventus.com|date=1 July 2015|accessdate=16 May 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== A creative, well-rounded and tactically versatile right-footed [[midfielder]],<ref name="Roberto Pereyra, nuovi Zanetti crescono"/> Pereyra is capable of playing in several midfield and [[Forward (association football)|offensive]] positions, due to his adaptability, energy, and his offensive and defensive work-rate.<ref name="Pereyra, dinamismo e duttilità"/> He is usually deployed as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|offensive midfielder]] in the centre, or as [[Midfielder#Wide midfielder|wide midfielder]], on either flank, although his preferred position is on the left wing; he has even played as a [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|second striker]] on occasion.<ref name="Pereyra, dinamismo e duttilità"/> Due to his attributes, playing position and nationality, he has been compared to the former Italo-Argentine Juventus [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] [[Mauro Camoranesi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tuttosport.com/calcio/serie_a/juventus/2014/07/25-301747/Pereyra,+colpo+da+17+milioni.+«Mi+ispiro+a+Camoranesi»|title=Pereyra, colpo da 17 milioni. "Mi ispiro a Camoranesi"|trans-title=Pereyra, 17 million deal. "I aspire to be like Camoranesi"|publisher=Tutto Sport|author1=Filippo Cornacchia|language=Italian|date=25 July 2014|accessdate=30 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/20-03-2016/juve-buffon-nessun-record-figlio-un-singolo-dico-grazie-ad-ognuno-1401091941968.shtml|title=Juve, Buffon: "Nessun record è figlio di un singolo, dico grazie ad ognuno..."|publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian|date=20 March 2016|accessdate=20 March 2016}}</ref> Pereyra is a quick, dynamic, and hardworking player, who possesses notable stamina, vision, and good [[Dribbling#Association football|technical skills]].<ref name="Pereyra, dinamismo e duttilità"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maidirecalcio.com/2015/04/09/lesplosione-di-pereyra-el-tucumano-al-servizio-della-juventus.html|title=L’esplosione di Pereyra: El Tucumano al servizio della Juventus|trans-title=Pereyra's Breakthrough: El Tucumano at Juventus's service|publisher=Mai Dire Calcio|author1=Cristiano Ciacci|language=Italian|date=9 April 2015|accessdate=30 May 2015}}</ref>
